page.title: 11 Building Whitemoor Mine
page.content: One man's job had been as a shaft sinker during the mine's construction. The Project had taken five and a half years to complete, from January 1980 to August 1985. He haded an 8 hour day, 7 days a week whenever possible, even through holiday periods. Ten men worked a shift in a 3 shift system, making a total of 60 me sinking shafts. Approximately 70 extra men were involved in tunnelling. His dislikes concerning the job included the hard work, the dirt, the noise and the lack of canteen facilities. However, it was possible to earn in excess of 20,000 pounds per annum during the project. There were hundreds of safety rules. The most obvious rules were that smoking was prohibited and wearing helmets, ear plugs and gloves was compulsory.
